intro: Eurybia cydoniifolia, commonly known as the pineapple weed, is a flowering plant in the family Asteraceae. It is native to Europe, Asia, and North Africa, and is often found in disturbed soils and along roadsides. The plant has a basal rosette of leaves that are covered in fine hairs, and it produces small, yellow flowers that develop into small, apple-shaped fruits. It is known for its ability to thrive in a variety of soil types and its tolerance to drought conditions. The plant is also used in traditional medicine for its purported health benefits.
